title: Letters to the Frameworks
synopsis: A collection of exhortations, advice, and rebukes sent by the elder Maintainer to various framework communities across the cloud.

sections.title: Letter to the Reactians

verses.text: Render not needlessly; for every rerender steals time from eternity.
Let your state be pure and your props unmutated.
And lo, when hooks are used with wisdom, your components shall find peace.

notes: A gentle call for simplicity and balance in component philosophy.

sections.title: Letter to the Vuenites

verses.text: Bind not without purpose, for excessive reactivity becometh obsession.
In your templates reflect grace, that the interface may delight the weary eye.
Greet your watchers with kindness, for they labor invisibly.

notes: Reflects the gentle aesthetic mysticism of the Vue sect.

sections.title: Letter to the Angularites

verses.text: Modularize all things, yet remember: too many modules maketh madness.
Faith without import is dead; structure without soul is scaffolding.
When simplicity returns, thy kingdom shall once more compile without error.

notes: A pastoral letter encouraging mercy toward legacy frameworks.
